Dear Kari Ann Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth was placed at facility, they were engaged in a sexual
relationship with a staff member at the facility.
Investigation This complaint was received on 05/23/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
I contact complainant on 05/23/2023 and confirmed the
allegations.
I interviewed Youth A’s Probation Officer on 05/23/2023 via
telephone. Probation Officer reported she has been assigned to
Youth A for 2 years. Youth A was placed at Lincoln Center for 6
months and she was meeting with Youth A weekly due to behavior
issues. Youth A never reported any concerns regarding staff at
Lincoln Center.
A Teams video conference was held with MDHHS Specialist 1
and MDHHS Specialist 2. MDHHS Specialist 2 was on-site with
Youth A conducting the interview. Youth A reported she was
placed at Lincoln Center for 7 months and was on Pod C. Youth A
denied having a sexual relationship with Supervisor 1 and denied
Supervisor 1 used to come into her bedroom. Youth A said male
staff were not allowed to enter girls’ rooms without a female staff.
Youth A admitted calling Supervisor 1 “uncle daddy” because he
was like a father figure. Youth A said there was one time she
grabbed Supervisor 1’s hand and put on ointment, because he is
allergic to latex gloves. She denied Supervisor 1 asking her to do
put the ointment on his hand. Youth A was adamant that she did
not have a sexual relationship with Supervisor 1 or any other staff
member while placed at Lincoln. She further denied Supervisor 1
talked or made remarks about her body or any other youth’s body.
She said, “I am only 14 years old and would not talk with grown
ass men like that.”
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 05/26/2023 in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 1 is a youth worker and has been
2

working at the facility for 3 months. She worked on Pod C when
Youth A was at the facility. She said Youth A was very destructive
and aggressive. Youth A broke the cameras on the pod. She said
Youth A was very attached to Supervisor 1 and would act out and
only take her medication if Supervisor 1 gave it to her. She
witnessed Youth A holding Supervisor 1’s hand. She denied
witnessing Supervisor 1 going into Youth A’s bedroom, and never
saw him say or do anything inappropriate with Youth A. She said
Youth A was very touchy with the male staff.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 05/26/2023 in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 1 is the manager and has been at
the facility over 20 years. She reported Youth A was very difficult
and aggressive. Youth A broke the cameras, flipped tables and
chairs. She denied being aware or witnessing Supervisor 1 have
an inappropriate relationship with Youth A or any other Youth. She
said Youth A was very flirtatious with the male staff, and staff
would redirect and not engage with Youth A. She did hear Youth A
refer to Supervisor 1 as “uncle daddy” and she had redirected her
to not use that term with staff.
I interviewed Director at the facility on 05/26/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. She reported there are no incident
reports or complaints involving Youth A having an inappropriate
relationship with staff. She reviewed video footage and found that
on 05/07/2023 and 05/08/2023 Supervisor 1 went into Youth A’s
room. Director said they don’t have policy regarding male staff
going into the girl’s room alone, but they advise against it.
I interviewed Youth B at Children’s Hospital on 06/01/2023 with
MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth B was previously placed at Lincoln
Center and was on the same Pod with Youth A. Youth B reported
she observed Youth A holding supervisor 1’s hand once and
heard Youth A refer to Supervisor 1 as “uncle daddy.” Youth B
denied witnessing Youth A engage in a sexually relationship with
Supervisor 1 or any other staff.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 06/01/2023 with MDHHS
Specialist 1. Youth C was on the same pod with Youth A at
Lincoln Center. Youth C recalled Youth A referring to Supervisor 1
as “uncle daddy” and Supervisor 1 would go to Youth A’s room.
Youth C denied witnessing anything sexual between Supervisor 1
and Youth A.
3

I spoke with Director on 06/01/2023 at the facility. Director
reported Supervisor 1 has been suspended pending the
investigation.
I interviewed Youth D at Juvenile Detention Center on 06/14/2023,
in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth D recalled that
while at Lincoln Center Supervisor 1 would look at her and made
remarks about her “ass” and he would hug the girls. She denied
having a sexual relationship with any staff at Lincoln or witnessing
any other youth having a sexual relationship with staff.
I interviewed Youth E at the facility on 06/15/2023 in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth E recalled Supervisor 1 being in
Youth A’s room, but never saw Supervisor 1 do anything sexual
with Youth A. She admitted Supervisor 1 sometimes made
remarks about his penis. She denied witnessing Youth A holding
hands with Supervisor 1.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility on 06/15/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported he
has worked at the facility for 16 years and is currently 2nd shift
supervisor. He denied having a sexual relationship with Youth A,
making inappropriate remarks about the youth’s body’s, making
remarks about his penis, or holding hands with Youth A. He
further denied Youth A held his hand or put ointment on his hands.
He said the reason he went to Youth A’s room was to complete a
room check for contraband.
During a conference call on 07/19/2023, MDHHS worker reported
there was a preponderance of evidence and Supervisor 1 will have a
confirmed case for improper supervision.
Video footage:
• On 05/07/2023 at 7:58pm Supervisor 1 follows Youth A to
her room for approximately one minute.
• On 05/08/2023 at 8:12 pm Supervisor 1 follows Youth A to
her room. There are two other staff members and two
youths on the wing. Youth E is observed standing outside
of Youth A’s bedroom while Supervisor 1 and Youth A are
in her room. Supervisor 1 and Youth A come out of the
bedroom at 08:28 pm.
Analysis There was insufficient evidence that Supervisor 1 was having sexual
relationship with Youth A based on interviews with staff, supervisor,
and youths.
4

The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 has a confirmed
case for improper supervision.
The allegations in reference to Supervisor 1 interacting and making
inappropriate remarks with the residents was investigated on
05/17/2023 under SI 2023C0000468.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not complete a check sheet when completing a room
search.
Investigation Supervisor 1 said he went to Youth A’s room on 05/08/2023 to
complete a room check for contraband, but a check sheet was
never completed.
Director reported there was no check sheet completed on Youth
A’s room on 05/08/2023.
Documents Reviewed:
Facility policy for Room Searches: The shift report check sheet
must be completed. Staff must make sure that the resident is not
in their room while the search is being conducted.
Analysis The facility is not compliant with the rule as interviews with
Supervisor indicated that he completed a room search on
05/08/2023, but there is no check sheet completed and the youth
was in the room during the reported search.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
